intro: Acinodendron rabenii, commonly known as the Madagascar rosewood, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dense, aromatic wood and attractive, small white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with simple, opposite leaves and clustered inflorescences. Its botanical significance lies in its unique morphology and ecological role in its native habitat. However, due to overharvesting, it is considered endangered and is protected in some regions.
